intro: Leonhardia viridis, commonly known as the green leonardia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of ponds and swamps. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Leonhardia viridis is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in wetland habitats.
